template.name: DKDateOrTimestamp
template.desc: Events occurring at a single point in time, precise to the date or time

desc.div:
The representation of time SHALL use the format YYYYMMDDhhmmss¬±ZZzz or YYYYMMDD¬±ZZzz
Token Description
YYYY The year of the event
MM The month in the year
DD The day in the month
hh The hour in the day
mm The minute of in the hour
ss The second in the minute
¬± Direction of the offset from UTC
ZZ Hours offset from UTC
zz Minutes offset in the hours offset from UTC

template.assert: The representation of time SHALL use the format YYYYMMDDhhmmss¬±ZZzz or YYYYMMDD¬±ZZzz

element.assert: extension must match extension of entry to nullify

element.desc: A durable identifier for this condition

example.caption: Durable identifier for a condition in Region Nordjylland with local unique identifier '9876543210'

attribute.name: extension
attribute.desc:
The value of @extension shall be created as a version 5 UUID in the following manner
Create an AuthorUUID in the namespace: cb839359-f063-501c-8529-70111460c60a with the SOR identifier of the author as the name
Create the ConditionUUID in the AuthorUUID namespace with the local unique identifier of the condtion.

element.name: hl7:id
element.desc:
A temporary identifier for this condition.
This identifier is used to resolve relationships within the encompassing CDA document instance.

attribute.name: extension
attribute.desc: The value of @extension shall be a version 4 UUID.

element.assert: The value of @root must be the same as /ClinicalDocument/setId/@root

template.name: DKInternalEpisodeOfCareMarkerReference
template.displayName: DK Internal Episode Of Care Marker Reference
template.desc: This template represents the act of referencing another entry in the same CDA document instance. Its purpose is to remove the need to repeat the complete XML representation of the referred entry when relating one entry to another. This template can be used to reference many types of Act class derivations, such as encounters, observations, procedures etc., as it is often necessary when authoring CDA documents to repeatedly reference other Acts of these types. For example, in a Care Plan it is necessary to repeatedly relate Health Concerns, Goals, Interventions and Outcomes. The id is required and must be the same id as the entry/id it is referencing. The id cannot be a null value. This means the value is not present in the message (in act/Code).

attribute.name: extension
attribute.desc: The value of @extension shall be a version 4 UUID to an episode of care marker within the encompassing CDA document instance.

This template can be used to reference many types of Act class derivations, such as encounters, observations, procedures etc., as it is often necessary when authoring CDA documents to repeatedly reference other Observations of these types. For example, in a Care Plan it is necessary to repeatedly relate Health Concerns, Goals, Interventions and Outcomes. The id is required and must be the same id as the entry/id it is referencing. The id cannot be a null value. This means the value is not present in the message (in act/Code).

element.name: hl7:id
element.desc: A durable identifier for this episode of care

example.caption: Durable identifier for an episode of care in Region Nordjylland with local unique identifier '1234567890'

attribute.name: root
attribute.desc: The value of @root shall be the same as the @root value of the clinical document setid.

attribute.name: extension
attribute.desc:
The value of @extension shall be created as a version 5 UUID in the following manner
Create an AuthorUUID in the namespace: fe537378-31eb-5036-91da-72ed4eecae10 with the SOR identifier of the author as the name
Create the EpisodeOfCareUUID in the AuthorUUID namespace with the local unique identifier of the episode of care.

element.assert: The value of @root must be the same as /ClinicalDocument/setId/@root

element.name: hl7:reference
element.assert: The id of this episode of care must be the same as the replacing episode of care

template.name: DKExternalEpisodeOfCareAct
template.displayName: DK External Episode Of Care Act
template.desc: This template represents the act of referring to an episode of care act that is external to the containing clinical document and defined in an external clinical document belonging to the same set as the containing document.

element.name: hl7:id

attribute.name: root
attribute.desc: The value of @root must be the same as the value of the containing ClinicalDocument setId root attribute. Ensuring that references can only be made to an external episode of care within the same set.

attribute.name: extension
attribute.desc: The value of @extension shall be a version 5 UUID to an existing episode of care

element.assert: The value of @root must be the same as /ClinicalDocument/setId/@root

attribute.name: root
attribute.desc: The value of @root shall be a version 5 UUID to an existing or future episode of care

attribute.name: extension
attribute.desc: LPR3: BetalingOplysning.betaler

template.name: DKDate
template.desc: Events occurring at a single point in time, precise to the date

desc.div:
The representation of time SHALL use the format YYYYMMDD¬±ZZzz
Token Description
YYYY The year of the event
MM The month in the year
DD The day in the month
¬± Direction of the offset from UTC
ZZ Hours offset from UTC
zz Minutes offset in the hours offset from UTC

template.assert: The representation of time SHALL use the format YYYYMMDD¬±ZZzz
